intro: Trisyngyne recurva, commonly known as the curly-stemmed trisyngyne, is a member of the family Myrtaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spirally twisted stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are typically small, woody capsules that contain several seeds. Trisyngyne recurva is often found in moist, shaded environments in tropical and subtropical regions.
